title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Monday, 7 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: a cyclist has died after being involved in a crash with a coach in cambridge last week .
syrian families have arrived in cambridge to be housed as part of the government 's refugee scheme .
more than 8,000 people in cambridgeshire used foodbanks between april and september , according to a charity .
a rocket taking raspberry pi computers to the international space station finally blasts off after being delayed by rain .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be be back from 08:00 tomorrow with the latest news , sport , travel and weather in the county .
if you have something to share with us , you can send us your stories and
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : rain approaching overnight
text: it will be a breezy but dry evening with some clear breaks , but cloud will thicken through the night as a band of rain approaches .
minimum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
it will be cloudy and breezy with outbreaks of rain on tuesday morning , heavy in places , but becoming brighter for the afternoon with sunny spells and a few scattered showers .
mild initially but turning cooler later , with a moderate southwesterly wind lifting temperatures up to 13c ( 55f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: life drawing classes promote positive body image , say cambridge researchers
text: new research conducted in cambridge has found that attending life drawing classes has a positive effect on body image - particularly for women .
researchers at anglia ruskin university studied the attitudes of 138 men and women , aged 18 to 76 , who regularly attended life drawing classes .
professor viren swami says : `` amongst women , greater attendance was significantly associated with higher body appreciation and a lower drive for thinness . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: syrian refugees in cambridge will not be given 'in-demand ' properties
text: syrian refugees arriving in cambridge are not being given the most `` in-demand '' one and two bedroom properties , says the leader of the city council .
the city , which has 1,600 people on its housing list , has agreed to host 50 syrian people over the next year .
labour leader lewis herbert says : `` we have limited what we are putting together as an offer , because we know we have a problem of people needing property in the city . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: daffodils in december a 'bit of a shock '
text: daffodils blooming in december are `` a bit of a shock , '' says the head a gardener of anglesey abbey , near cambridge .
richard todd told bbc radio cambridgeshire this is the earliest he can remember daffodils flowering in the grounds of the national trust property .
snowdrops are also on display , which he says is down to unseasonably warm weather .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : cyclist dies following crash with coach syrian refugees will not be given 'in-demand ' cambridge properties
text: here are the latest headlines for cambridgeshire :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: man 's body found in peterborough river
text: a man 's body has been found off lincoln road in werrington .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: football : peterborough boss says he wo n't be watching tonight 's fa cup draw
text: posh manager graham westley says he wo n't be watching the draw for the third round of the fa cup - which takes place tonight .
peterborough are in the hat following yesterday 's 2-0 win over luton at london road .
westley told bbc radio cambridgeshire he 's relieved `` to have got the job done '' .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: public ask to help tackle 'flood risk weed '
text: cambridgeshire may have escaped the floods affecting parts of england , but the public are being asked to help tackle an invasive weed , which increases the risk of flooding .
the environment agency is asking people to report sightings of floating pennywort , that can grow up to 20cm ( 7in ) a day , choking rivers .
it is a problem on waterways in cambridgeshire - .
the agency has just completed an operation to clear it from bottisham lode .
author: Alex Harris
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: man injured in whittlesey conveyor belt injury
text: a man in his 50s has been taken to hospital following an industrial accident in whittlesey .
the ambulance service says he suffered chest pain and an ankle injury after falling on to a conveyor beltand travelling 30 metres ( 98ft ) .
he was taken to peterborough city hospital for treatment at around 08:49 .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : cyclist dies following collision with coach syrian refugees arrive in cambridge
text: if you 're just joining us , here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this afternoon :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: raspberry pi computers hurtle through space
text: two cambridge-designed raspberry pi computers will reach the international space station on wednesday , after the successful launch of the spacecraft carrying them last night .
the cygnus capsule carries more than 3,500kg ( 7,700lb ) of food , clothing , computer gear , spacewalk equipment , science experiments and other supplies .
the computers will be used in experiments .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cyclist dies following coach collision
text: cambridgeshire police has confirmed that a woman who was involved in a collision in cambridge last wednesday has died .
jane herbert , 61 , of latham road in the city , was cycling on trumpington road when she collided with a coach .
witnesses are asked to contact the road policing unit on 101 .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingcyclist dies following collision in cambridge
text: a cyclist who was injured following a collision in cambridge last week has died , say police .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: snooker championships : victory was about 'digging in and nicking frames '
text: `` in the end , it was about digging in and nicking frames , '' said cambridge-based neil robertson after winning the uk snooker championship .
watch the closing stages as robertson wins his second uk title , beating liang wenbo 10-5 in the final in york .
robertson made a 147 maximum break earlier in the final - watch that in full here .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: plans to build traveller site in stretham station road , wilburton
text: a new traveller site looks set to be built in wilburton .
east cambridgeshire district council has received plans for eight traveller pitches to be built on land north of amberside , based in stretham station road .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: blooming early : snowdrops appear at anglesey abbey
text: snowdrops are blooming early in the grounds of anglesey abbey , near cambridge .
the national trust property is famous for its annual snowdrop festival , which starts at the end of january .
`` we 've had lovely weather so they 're coming out , '' said head gardener richard todd .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tree uprooted as storm desmond hits peterborough
text: strong winds hit peterborough over the weekend causing a tree to be uprooted in yaxley , along with the closure of bourges boulevard in the city centre .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: weather : turning drier and brighter , maximum temperature 14c ( 57f )
text: this afternoon will stay dry with some prolonged sunshine .
it will get increasingly breezy but will stay mild .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : offal spillage closes a14 westbound near cambridge
text: the a14 westbound is closed at junction 31 for the m11 .
police have told us it is due to an offal spillage .
# a1307 huntingdon road # girton is now closed to allow for clean up of a spillage on the a14 westbound .
use alternative routes .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: peterborough broken bottle attack : police release image of man
text: police have released the image of a man they are trying to trace following an attack with a broken bottle in peterborough .
a 21-year-old man suffered serious head injuries in the attack in millfield at 06:30 on saturday .
detectives say they would like to speak to daniel kilroy , 24 , from peterborough , about the attack .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : emergency repairs close one lane on a14 westbound between junction 23 and 24
text: one lane remains closed on thea14 westbound between junction 23 , spittals interchange , and junction 22 , huntingdon racecourse , due to emergency road repairs .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: syrian refugees arrive in cambridge : 'it 's right we do our bit , ' says city mp
text: `` it is right we do out bit , '' says cambridge 's labour mp , as the first syrian refugees arrive in the city .
the families are the first to be settled in the east of england as part of the government 's vulnerable persons relocation scheme .
the city has agreed to host 50 syrian people over the next year , but daniel zeichner told bbc radio cambridgeshire it could take `` as many again '' .
author: Ben Stevenson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : first syrian refugee families arrive in cambridge robertson crowned snooker champion
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this morning :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: broken bottle attack in peterborough
text: a 21-year-old man has been hurt in a broken bottle attack in peterborough .
the victim was taken to hospital with multiple head wounds , after the assault in millfield at 06:30 on saturday .
anyone with information is asked to contact police .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: stagecoach unveils £ 17m plan to provide emissions-free buses through cambridge city centre
text: cambridge 's buses could soon be running emissions-free under an ambitious £ 17m plan to improve the city 's air quality .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: more private landlords needed to house syrian refugees , say campaigners
text: more private landlords are needed to house syrian refugees , according to the cambridge refugee resettlement campaign .
the latest refugees arriving in the city as part of the government scheme will be given legal protection and access to housing , employment and education .
campaigner camilla ittura says : `` the council have got very few houses available .
we need the private landlords , of whom there are many , with many empty houses '' .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: football : peterborough beat luton 2-0 to reach fa cup third round
text: peterborough united comfortably saw off luton to reach the fa cup third round despite missing several opportunities .

peterborough boss graham westley told bbc radio cambridgeshire : `` we could have done some real damage , we crafted a lot of chances and on a different day , that could have turned into a big score '' .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: we have lift-off : nasa rocket carrying raspberry pi computers blasts into space
text: there were celebrations at the raspberry pi headquarters in cambridge when a rocket taking two of their computers into space finally blasted-off last night - after being cancelled three times because of bad weather .
nasa says the launch was a success and the spacecraft carrying the specially-adapted computers will arrive at the international space station on wednesday .
once there british astronaut tim peake will use the computers in a series of experiments devised by school pupils - ranging from reaction-time games to looking at radiation in space .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: motorcyclist involved in collision at nene parkway junction in peterborough
text: a motorcyclist has been involved in a collision in peterborough this morning .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: cambridge hosts inaugral christmas pudding race
text: at least 60 people took part in the first christmas pudding race in cambridge at the weekend .
ten teams of six carried a pudding on a baking tray around an obstacle course on parker 's piece .
organisers say the event raised £ 6,000 for cancer research uk .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: uk snooker championship final : cambridge-based neil robertson makes 147 and wins title
text: cambridge-based neil robertson became the first player to make a maximum 147 break in a uk championship final on his way to beating liang wenbo 10-5 .
the australian made the perfect break in the sixth frame of the match in york - the third 147 of his career .
`` as a kid , you always want to make a 147 on the bbc so it was a dream come true , '' he said after the win .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: syrian families arrive in cambridge as part of government refugee scheme
text: syrian families have arrived in cambridge to be housed as part of the government 's refugee scheme .
the city has agreed to provide home for 50 people over the next year .
the families are the first to be settled in the east of england since the government expanded its vulnerable persons relocation scheme .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cyclists and drivers in tit-for-tat battle over bad parking in cambridge
text: a police campaign to highlight badly parked bikes and cars in cambridge has started a tit-for-tat twitter war between cyclists and drivers .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: headlines : syrian families arrive in cambridge as part of refugee scheme cambridge raspberry pi computers blasted into space
text: here are the headlines in cambridgeshire this morning :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a grey start with a little light rain , top temperature 14c ( 57f )
text: after a grey start it should be a mostly dry day with increasing amounts of bright or sunny spells .
it will again be mild , but breezy .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to cambridgeshire live
text: good morning and welcome to another week of cambridgeshire live .
as usual , we 'll be be here until 18:00 with the latest news , sport , travel and weather in the county .
you can send us your stories and
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live
